definition[0]: a playing card that can represent any other card
definition[1]: someone whose behaviour or effect on a situation is difficult to guess
definition[2]: a player who is a wild card or who is given a wild card is chosen for a competition although they have not previously done well enough to take part
definition[3]: a symbol that can represent any letter in some computer instructions
definition[4]: something that has an unexpected effect on a situation
example[0]: A wild card in the companyâ€™s prospects is the disagreement that has broken out between the company and some of its 16,000 workers.
definition[5]: a sign that can represent any letter in some computer commands
